title: Verified Purchase
content: I almost dumped the book from my Kindle because of the plot design: two seemingly unrelated characters, Colby and Beverly, with absolutely no connection.  Colby’s story seemed like the typical Nicholas Sparks romance novel.  Beverly’s story was very unsettling and upsetting, almost like a thriller/mystery.  I thought, after a couple of chapters, I’ll just read the “Colby” chapters.  But I persevered begrudgingly and suffered through the Beverly story too. (Spoiler Alert) My mother had Bipolar 1 mental illness all her life.  Too many memories were evoked as I read about Beverly.  Nicholas Sparks either did a lot of research or knows someone with Bipolar 1 very well: he absolutely nailed not only the daily chaos, but the inner workings of the mind, especially during the “manic” phase.  In the end, Colby’s story had a predictable resolution.  Trust me when I say, Beverly’s story will be on a repeat cycle for the rest of her life…sadly.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on July 1, 2023

title: Good condition
content: I think  the author should have had a trigger warning for readers. This book contains some distressing events mixed in with a "normal" love story.I found myself skimming through a lot of this book as it droned on for too long about details that didn't matter. Little character development and lots of events glossed over, such as the love part. The description of mental health sounded straight from Google. As a therapist, I was frustrated that the author didn't realize schizoaffective disorder seems more accurate of a diagnosis. And the pirate part, just was weird and shouldn't have been there.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on June 2, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: The story of brother and sister seemed separate and disjointed: Colby’s full of the joy of new love; Beverly’s (Paige’s) unbearably painful. Even the most clever mystery buff would not have suspected the surprise of how they came together. As a therapist myself, I very much appreciate how the author portrays bipolar disorder, as a series of disruptions to an otherwise highly creative and hopeful life. And Colby’s devotion to his family did not necessarily mean an end to his own future happiness. Hope lives for us all.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on February 27, 2024

post_time: Reviewed in the United States on April 4, 2024

title: Unexpected story style
content: Of course there's a love story, but this book has several twists. Colby always wanted to perform, but family issues forced him to take over the homestead. When the opportunity arises to take a short hiatus from his daily life, he jumps at the chance. There he is drawn to a young, wide-eyed college student, Morgan, also there on vacation with friends, thus the love story angle. Then there is stressed beyond belief, Beverly, at first the reader is not sure how she fits into the book's storyline. Morgan's aspirations vs her parents' goals, vs new love, must say good-bye to Colby, who must return home and reality. Beverly's life bubble breaks, all within the course of a week.  This twisted tale was an interesting read, but not even in the top 10 of his books.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2023
